text:
Two killed in accident

R. Chitra (65), from Mylapore in Chennai, and her adopted son M. Krishnamoorthy (46), were killed when the car in which they were travelling collided with a lorry on the Neelambur Bypass on Monday. The police said that they were on way to Kerala from Chennai. They hailed from Palakkad.

Elephant damages house

A wild elephant on Monday damaged the house of Veerammal (70) at Thaliyur, near Pannimadai village. Veerammal and her family members escaped without injuries as they were sleeping outside the house.

Four held

The police on Sunday arrested four persons on the charge of illegal transport of river sand from Karur to Kerala. Two trucks carrying the sand were stopped by the police at the Velanthavalam checkpost. The arrested were: V. Mohan (42) from Palakkad, and A. Jeeva (38), R. Nataraj (38) and P. Magudeeswaran (34), from Dharapuram in Tirupur. They have been booked under the Tamil Nadu Mines and Minerals Development Regulation Act and the Tamil Nadu Mines and Minerals Concession Rules Act, read with 379 (punishment for theft) of the Indian Penal Code.
